alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 11 at 2:48PM MST until June 12 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MST SUNDAY FOR THE YAVAPAI MOUNTAINS, COCONINO AND KAIBAB PLATEAUS, AND THE LITTLE COLORADO RIVER VALLEY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR THE YAVAPAI MOUNTAINS, COCONINO AND KAIBAB PLATEAUS, AND THE LITTLE COLORADO RIVER VALLEY... * AFFECTED AREA...Locations near Dilkon, Fredonia, Grand Canyon, Jacob Lake, Kykotsmovi, North Rim, Page, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Seligman, Shonto, Tuba City and Valle. This includes portions of the Coconino National Forest, Kaibab National Forest, Prescott National Forest and Tonto National Forest. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 7 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first responders can contain them.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring or are imminent. A combination of strong winds and low relative humidities can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Please notify field crews of this Red Flag Warning. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings. Please notify field crews of this Fire Weather Watch.
